bill_title: require that certain heliports be approved by the South Dakota Aeronautics Commission.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain heliports be approved by the South Dakota Aeronautics Commission. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 50-5 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any owner or operator of a private heliport that is used for at least one hundred twenty takeoffs and one hundred twenty landings by one or more helicopters in any year shall apply to the commission for approval or licensure for the heliport. Application for any such private heliport, including any such heliport in existence on the effective date of this Act, shall be made not later than the end of the first calendar year after 2011 in which the number of takeoffs and landings specified in this section occurred. For purposes of this section, the term, heliport, means an airport or landing field, as defined in § 50-1-1, that is used or intended for use for the landing and takeoff of helicopters. 180 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.063 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
